Turkey

Flag of Kastamonu Province

The flag is white with the logo.

https://www.koroglugazetesi.com/haber/bolu-valisi-ahmet-umitin-5-aralik-dunya-kadin-haklari-gunu-mesaji.html

Tomislav Šipek, 5 September 2021

The building featured on the logo is the Governor's Office, also featured on the emblem of the Kastamonu City Council.

The building was inaugurated on 1 September 1901 during the celebration of the 25th anniversary of enthronement of Sultan Abdul Hamid II. The noted architect Vedat Tek, who also designed the old Parliament in Ankara, the Izmir clock tower and the Ministry of Post and Telegraph in Istanbul, was commissioned to replace the old, wooden building that had been inaugurated in 1833.

See also: Kastamonu City Council

Ivan Sache, 5 September 2021

Special Provincial Administration

Flag of the Kastamonu Special Provincial Administration - Image by Tomislav Šipek, 2 January 2018

The flag of the Kastamonu Special Provincial Administration (photo) is white with the administration's emblem. "T.C." stands for "Türkiye Cumhuriyeti", "Republic of Turkey"; "İl Özel İdaresi" means "Special Provincial Administration".
